name: Sourdough Starter IV
author: Paula
summary: A sourdough starter that uses the liquid from boiled potatoes to attract wild yeast.
directions: Combine potatoes and water in a small stock pot or medium saucepan
Cover and boil until potatoes are tender, about 35 minutes
Drain cooking liquid into a large glass measuring cup
Transfer 1 1/4 cups of potato liquid to large ceramic or glass bowl
Add flour, sugar and salt to bowl; stir to combine
Cover bowl with cheesecloth and let stand at room temperature until starter begins to ferment and bubble, about 4 days
Starter is now ready to use
Storage and feeding of starter: Transfer to covered plastic container and store in refrigerator
Begin each feeding by discarding all but 1 cup
Mix 1 cup flour and 1 cup warm water (105 to 115 degrees F) into remaining mixture
Cover with plastic; let stand at room temperature overnight
